title: Headline Level in API Doc Comments

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-dev-tools
labels.description: Relevant to the dev-tools subteam, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
The API docs seem semantically quite nice, but don't incorporate headlines in comments into their document outline. The `Vec` doc e.g. uses an `h1` for the title, `h2` for "Methods", `h3`s for impl names and `h4`s for item names. Then a comment contains an `h1` ("Examples") and the outline is ruined.

_(This is a rustdoc issue, with probably low priority. It came up in #20826.)_

One possibility to fix this is to switch to `section` and `article` tags as described by HTML5—currently, everything is a `div`. You can find some [documentation here](https://developer.mozilla.org/de/docs/Web/Guide/HTML/Sections_and_Outlines_of_an_HTML5_document). Basically, this allows markup like the following to be meaningful:

``` jade
main.content.struct
  h1 Struct std::vec::Vec
  pre.rust.struct ... code ...
  article.docblock
    h1 Examples
    // ...
  section.methods
    h1 Methods
    section.impl
      h1 impl‹T› Vec‹T›
      section.method
        h1 fn new() → Vec‹T›
        article.docblock
           p Constructs a new, empty Vec‹T›.
           h1 Examples
           // ...
      section.method
        h1 fn with_capacity(capacity: usize) → Vec‹T›
        article.docblock
           p Constructs a new, empty Vec‹T› with the specified capacity.
           h1 Examples
           // ...
```

(This syntax is [Jade](http://jade-lang.com/), it shows the outline quite niceley. I replaced some characters to prevent escaping.)
